message.content:
1. Normal vitamin D levels are considered to be over 30 ng/dl.
2. There were ten UC patients in the 4,000 IU group.
3. Four out of the ten UC patients in the 4,000 IU group achieved normal vitamin D levels.
4. The percentage of UC patients in the 4,000 IU group who achieved normal vitamin D levels is 40%.
5. There were eight UC patients in the 2,000 IU group.
6. One out of the eight UC patients in the 2,000 IU group achieved normal vitamin D levels.
7. The percentage of UC patients in the 2,000 IU group who achieved normal vitamin D levels is 12%.

messages.content:
Statement: Normal vitamin D levels (>30 ng/dl) were achieved in four out of the ten UC patients (40%) in the 4,000 IU group and in one out of the eight UC patients (12%) in the 2,000 IU group.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
